block.p: LEAD: STIRLING MOSS, the former British race-car driver who won 222 races, including 16 Grand Prix events, suffered a broken thigh when he was hit by a car while riding his motor scooter in London yesterday. It may take six months for the 60-year-old former champion to recover from the injury. Mr. Moss, whose career began in 1950, said he was driving at 20 miles an hour, on a trip to the market to buy coriander.
